title: San Juan Island National Historical Park: Summer Employment Opportunities for Youth
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     Work With Us     Summer Employment Opportunities for Youth              Summer Employment Opportunities for Youth       San Juan Island National Historical Park is soliciting applications for up to six (6) seasonal positions for the 2016 summer season. The jobs are in resource and facility management as part of a Youth Conservation Corps crew. Applications will be accepted between March 27 and April 30, 2016. Click here for a detailed job description. For an application, click here.  A variety of duties may be expected, including assisting with plant propagation, seed collection, weeding, landscaping, carpentry, photography, trail maintenance, interpretation and education. Orientation and training will be provided. Applicants should be between the ages of 16 and 19, with a positive attitude and a desire to learn. Successful candidates will exhibit an ability to follow instructions and perform moderate physical work in a safe manner. Employment will be 40 hours/week between June 27 and August 20. Pay will be $9.47/hr. Sturdy boots and long pants will be required, and hats for sun protection are advised. Other personal protection equipment will be provided by the park. For more information contact Steve Ray at (360) 378-2240 x2234 or by email.  Â     Youth crew members help with tree removal in the 2014 summer season. NPS Photo/Gary Tarleton
